The KJV is one translation. It is wrong in a number of areas. The most obvious example is translating one of the 10 commandments as "thouse shalt not kill", when "thou shalt not murder" is generally thought to be a more accurate rendering. There are many translations of the Bible, some are more literal than others. Modern translations benefit from a sounder knowledge of ancient greek and hebrew than was available to the scholars assembled by James I/VI. The KJV is broadly accurate, but there are individual passages or words that are not as precise as they should be. Young's literal translation says dragon (which usually means a snake of some sort) but not any of the others you flag up.
 
 The idea that the KJV is the one true version of the Bible is a pretty laughable one with no basis in anything except wishful thinking.
